newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo rubber futures jump on yen's dive.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo rubber futures jump on yen's dive.

text.p: Tokyo rubber futures ended sharply higher on Thursday, lifted by active short-covering, reflecting the yen's sharp fall against the dollar, traders said.
Prices ranged from 4.9 yen to 6.4 yen per kg higher, with benchmark July contract finishing up 4.9 yen at 156.0 yen.
The market started firmer, with bullish sentiment carried over from the previous day.
"Good tyre demand in Japan and views that overseas markets are set to rise ahead of a seasonal fall in output, were bullish factors for the market," one trader said.
